metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20221 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description: An out-of-bounds heap buffer access issue was found in the ARM GenericInterrupt Controller emulator of QEMU up to and including qemu 4.2.0onaarch64 platform. The issue occurs because while writing an interrupt ID tothe controller memory area, it is not masked to be 4 bits wide. It may leadto the said issue while updating controller state fields and theirsubsequent processing. A privileged guest user may use this flaw to crashthe QEMU process on the host resulting in DoS scenario.

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
